name: Andromeda Elite Helmet
description: This special-issue Andromeda Initiative helmet is custom designed for explorers who excel in the Initiative training programs taken on prior to departing for Andromeda. Its Pathfinder-grade construction is strong enough to protect the wearer from the dangers of unexplored space while remaining light enough to allow full mobility.

name: Angaran Arms
description: This armor integrates angaran hardware with Initiative software, resulting in a sturdy hardsuit that utilizes technologies unique to the Heleus Cluster. Various adjustments have been made to the design to accommodate non-angaran biology.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): If a target is primed fire, cold or lightning by one of your spells and the condition ends "at the start of your next turn", instead the condition ends at the end of your next turn.
Set bonus (4 of 4): When one of your drones hits with a weapon attack, add twice your proficiency bonus to the damage roll.

name: Angaran Chestpiece
description: This armor integrates angaran hardware with Initiative software, resulting in a sturdy hardsuit that utilizes technologies unique to the Heleus Cluster. Various adjustments have been made to the design to accommodate non-angaran biology.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): If a target is primed fire, cold or lightning by one of your spells and the condition ends "at the start of your next turn", instead the condition ends at the end of your next turn.
Set bonus (4 of 4): When one of your drones hits with a weapon attack, add twice your proficiency bonus to the damage roll.

name: Angaran Helmet
description: This armor integrates angaran hardware with Initiative software, resulting in a sturdy hardsuit that utilizes technologies unique to the Heleus Cluster. Various adjustments have been made to the design to accommodate non-angaran biology.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): If a target is primed fire, cold or lightning by one of your spells and the condition ends "at the start of your next turn", instead the condition ends at the end of your next turn.
Set bonus (4 of 4): When one of your drones hits with a weapon attack, add twice your proficiency bonus to the damage roll.

name: Angaran Legs
description: This armor integrates angaran hardware with Initiative software, resulting in a sturdy hardsuit that utilizes technologies unique to the Heleus Cluster. Various adjustments have been made to the design to accommodate non-angaran biology.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): If a target is primed fire, cold or lightning by one of your spells and the condition ends "at the start of your next turn", instead the condition ends at the end of your next turn.
Set bonus (4 of 4): When one of your drones hits with a weapon attack, add twice your proficiency bonus to the damage roll.

name: Archon Visor
description: The Archon visor uses an efficient algorithm to balance processing power for omni-tools. A heads-up display and voice command software allows users to micromanage the systems, reducing the cool-down period between energy expenditures.
features: As an action, gain 1d4 worth of spell slots or tech points. You canâ€™t use this property again until you finish a long rest.

name: Asari Initiate Armor
description: Standard issue armor for all Asari infantry. Build-in biotic amps provide a minor boost to biotic powers.
features: While wearing this armor, your cantrips are considered to be 1 step higher in their progression. For example, a 1st level player casts a cantrip as if they were at the 5th level. 5th -> 11th. 11th -> 17th. There is no additional effect at the 17th level.

name: Assassin Armor
description: Elkoss Combine was commissioned by the Salarian Tactics Group to make a set of armor that would allow their agents to remain unseen and unheard.
features: As an action, you can activate a tactical cloak, becoming invisible. The cloak lasts 1 minute or until you make an attack, cast a spell, use a grenade or mine, or fire a heavy weapon. You may use this feature once per short rest.

name: Batarian Talon Gauntlets
description: A set of spiked, clawed gauntlets that give the appearance of their wearer possessing demonic hands.
features: Add 1 point of Slashing damage to all melee damage rolls. Advantage on Intimidation skill checks.

name: Blood Dragon Armet
description: Originally created for Earth's Urban Combat Championship league, this set of armor has undergone as much or more field testing than those of modern militaries. It uses a unique, proprietary power cell that costs as much as a EUCC rookie's contract. The armor's microframe computer adapts to any top-tier omni-tool, kinetic barrier, or biotic amp, giving breathtaking and error-free performance.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): When you roll a 1 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
Set bonus (4 of 4): When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
features: You regain 1d4 worth of spell slots or tech points when you take a short rest.

name: Blood Dragon Curiass
description: Originally created for Earth's Urban Combat Championship league, this set of armor has undergone as much or more field testing than those of modern militaries. It uses a unique, proprietary power cell that costs as much as a EUCC rookie's contract. The armor's microframe computer adapts to any top-tier omni-tool, kinetic barrier, or biotic amp, giving breathtaking and error-free performance. The chest and shoulder piece bears the logo of the Edmonton Blood Dragons, and the inside of the armor bears the signatures of the entire team.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): When you roll a 1 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
Set bonus (4 of 4): When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.

name: Blood Dragon Greaves
description: Originally created for Earth's Urban Combat Championship league, this set of armor has undergone as much or more field testing than those of modern militaries. It uses a unique, proprietary power cell that costs as much as a EUCC rookie's contract. The armor's microframe computer adapts to any top-tier omni-tool, kinetic barrier, or biotic amp, giving breathtaking and error-free performance.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): When you roll a 1 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
Set bonus (4 of 4): When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
features: +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell saving throw DCs.

name: Blood Dragon Vambraces
description: Originally created for Earth's Urban Combat Championship league, this set of armor has undergone as much or more field testing than those of modern militaries. It uses a unique, proprietary power cell that costs as much as a EUCC rookie's contract. The armor's microframe computer adapts to any top-tier omni-tool, kinetic barrier, or biotic amp, giving breathtaking and error-free performance.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): When you roll a 1 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
Set bonus (4 of 4): When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.
features: +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell saving throw DCs.

name: BT Suit
description: Equipped with a full battle telemetry system to increase Omni-tool power efficiency.
features: You can regain 2d4 tech points every short rest.

name: Capacitor Helmet
description: A recent design, this Alliance-made helmet stores micro capacitors in its structure to replenish spent kinetic barriers. The transpari-plast armor panel on its top can be removed to access capacitors for field maintenance.
features: +1 AC. Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.

name: Cerberus Ajax Gauntlets
description: Among Cerberus soldiers, Ajax armor is favored by those brave or unlucky enough to lead charges to break enemy formations. Its role is to keep the wearer standing and shooting as long as possible. It offers some benefit to omni-tool and biotic amp systems, but its main emphasis is boosting and recharging its kinetic barrier and bleeding off weapon heat through coolant circulation in its gloves.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Equipped weapons have increased heat equal to half its base heat (rounded down).
Set bonus (4 of 4): Shield Regen 20

name: Cerberus Ajax Greaves
description: Among Cerberus soldiers, Ajax armor is favored by those brave or unlucky enough to lead charges to break enemy formations. Its role is to keep the wearer standing and shooting as long as possible. It offers some benefit to omni-tool and biotic amp systems, but its main emphasis is boosting and recharging its kinetic barrier and bleeding off weapon heat through coolant circulation in its gloves.

description: Among Cerberus soldiers, Ajax armor is favored by those brave or unlucky enough to lead charges to break enemy formations. It offers some benefit to omni-tool and biotic amp systems, but its main emphasis is boosting and recharging its kinetic barrier and bleeding off weapon heat through coolant circulation in its gloves.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Equipped weapons have increased heat equal to half its base heat (rounded down).
Set bonus (4 of 4): Shield Regen 20

name: Cerberus Assault Armor
description: Cerberus assault armor is designed for shock troops, who are expected to turn the tide of battle against creatures or forces that would decimate normal soldiers. The troops demanded three things in its design: shields and armor thick enough to last against a superior foe, and compartments for extra thermal clips. The only drawback of the armor is its weight, which the troops carry as a point of pride. They have a saying: "Out of shape going in, in shape coming out."
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): +2 AC

name: Cerberus Assault Helmet
description: Cerberus assault armor is designed for shock troops, who are expected to turn the tide of battle against creatures or forces that would decimate normal soldiers. The troops demanded three things in its design: shields and armor thick enough to last against a superior foe, and compartments for extra thermal clips. The only drawback of the armor is its weight, which the troops carry as a point of pride. They have a saying: "Out of shape going in, in shape coming out."
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): +2 AC

name: Cerberus Nightmare Boots
description: Nightmare armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms expecting long-range conflicts. Powerful capacitors deliver punishing energy to the Phantom's weapons, and circulating coolant in its gloves allows for more shots before a given thermal clip overheats. The remaining energy focuses on shield strength and regeneration time to help survivability.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
Set bonus (3 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
Set bonus (4 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.

description: Nightmare armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms expecting long-range conflicts. Powerful capacitors deliver punishing energy to the Phantom's weapons, and circulating coolant in its gloves allows for more shots before a given thermal clip overheats. The remaining energy focuses on shield strength and regeneration time to help survivability.

Set bonus (3 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
Set bonus (4 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.

Set bonus (3 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.

features: Equipped weapons have increased heat equal to twice the weapon's base heat.

name: Cerberus Nightmare Helmet
description: Nightmare armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms expecting long-range conflicts. Powerful capacitors deliver punishing energy to the Phantom's weapons, and circulating coolant in its gloves allows for more shots before a given thermal clip overheats. The remaining energy focuses on shield strength and regeneration time to help survivability.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
Set bonus (3 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
Set bonus (4 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
features: +1 bonus to melee weapon attack and damage rolls.

name: Cerberus Shade Armguards
description: Cerberus Shade armor is worn by Phantoms who need to be prepared for a wide variety of threats. Its capacitors give modest boosts to shields and shield regeneration time. Many small improvements increase the performance of biotic amps and omni-tools, heat management and kinetic coils for ranged weapons, and synthetic muscle assistors for melee capability.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.
Set bonus (4 of 4): +10 shields. +10 shield regen.
features: +1 bonus to melee weapon attack and damage rolls

name: Cerberus Shade Chestpiece
description: Cerberus Shade armor is worn by Phantoms who need to be prepared for a wide variety of threats. Its capacitors give modest boosts to shields and shield regeneration time. Many small improvements increase the performance of biotic amps and omni-tools, heat management and kinetic coils for ranged weapons, and synthetic muscle assistors for melee capability.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.

name: Cerberus Shade Helmet
description: Cerberus Shade armor is worn by Phantoms who need to be prepared for a wide variety of threats. Its capacitors give modest boosts to shields and shield regeneration time. Many small improvements increase the performance of biotic amps and omni-tools, heat management and kinetic coils for ranged weapons, and synthetic muscle assistors for melee capability.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.

features: +1 bonus to spell attack and damage rolls

name: Cerberus Shade Legguards
description: Cerberus Shade armor is worn by Phantoms who need to be prepared for a wide variety of threats. Its capacitors give modest boosts to shields and shield regeneration time. Many small improvements increase the performance of biotic amps and omni-tools, heat management and kinetic coils for ranged weapons, and synthetic muscle assistors for melee capability.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.
Set bonus (4 of 4): +10 shields. +10 shield regen.

name: Cerberus Spirit Armor
description: Spirit armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms fortunate enough to be biotic or for those who are skilled enough to use highly technical attacks. The armor has small gains for shield strength and regeneration, but where it truly shines is in its capacity to amplify biotic amps and omni-tools. These attacks hit significantly harder and more often, allowing the Phantom to dismantle heavily-armored targets.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.

name: Cerberus Spirit Helmet
description: Spirit armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms fortunate enough to be biotic or for those who are skilled enough to use highly technical attacks. The armor has small gains for shield strength and regeneration, but where it truly shines is in its capacity to amplify biotic amps and omni-tools. These attacks hit significantly harder and more often, allowing the Phantom to dismantle heavily-armored targets.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.
features: When you roll a 1 or a 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic or tech spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.

name: Collector Carapace
description: The Collectors' chitinous armor is flexible and even tougher than ballistic fibers. Its organic construction allows it to be self-healing, and the muscle-like tissue that assists movement ensures it is comfortable to wear despite its weight. This suit was originally adapted out of salvaged Collector technology by Cerberus and is incredibly difficult to find on the galactic market.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): Once per long rest, when you fall below 0 hit points, you immediately become stabilized.

name: Collector Headpiece
description: The Collectors' chitinous armor is flexible and even tougher than ballistic fibers. Its organic construction allows it to be self-healing, and the muscle-like tissue that assists movement ensures it is comfortable to wear despite its weight. This suit was originally adapted out of salvaged Collector technology by Cerberus and is incredibly difficult to find on the galactic market.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): Once per long rest, when you fall below 0 hit points, you immediately become stabilized.

name: Colossus Chestplate
description: A bulky, heavy armor set that is difficult to wear for those not in superior shape. But considered the galaxy's best defensive suit.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): Resistance to necrotic and cold damage.
Set bonus (3 of 4): Resistance to fire and force damage.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Resistance to lightning damage.

name: Colossus Gauntlets
description: A bulky, heavy armor set that is difficult to wear for those not in superior shape. But considered the galaxy's best defensive suit.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): Resistance to necrotic and cold damage.
Set bonus (3 of 4): Resistance to fire and force damage.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Resistance to lightning damage.

name: Colossus Greaves
description: A bulky, heavy armor set that is difficult to wear for those not in superior shape. But considered the galaxy's best defensive suit.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): Resistance to necrotic and cold damage.
Set bonus (3 of 4): Resistance to fire and force damage.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Resistance to lightning damage.

name: Colossus Helmet
description: A bulky, heavy armor set that is difficult to wear for those not in superior shape. But considered the galaxy's best defensive suit.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): Resistance to necrotic and cold damage.
Set bonus (3 of 4): Resistance to fire and force damage.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Resistance to lightning damage.

name: Crisis Armor
description: Crisis Armor is manufactured by Jormangund Technology, a rising star of post-contact human industry. The armor is lightweight but provides incredible protection.
features: Required STR is 14 instead of 16. You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor.

name: Death Mask
description: Developed by Tyriel Advanced Communications Corporation (TACC), the latest version of the Death Mask offers exceptional protection and real-time data feedback that helps coordinate the wearer's melee attacks.
features: +1 on melee attack and damage rolls

name: Deep Space Explorer Armor
description: The Andromeda Initiative's mission is one of discovery and exploration, as well as colonization. Readying personnel to journey into harsh environments-and even the void of space was always part of the plan. Thus, the Initiative's custom Deep Space Explorer (DSE) hardsuit is equipped with multiple environment seals, failsafes, a hefty liquid oxygen supply, a formidable kinetic barrier generator, and an array of scientific instruments. Although many were built, most were mysteriously lost en route to Andromeda.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): Extended air supply allows the wearer to breathe in unfriendly environments for up to 48 hours.
features: Resistance to cold and fire damage.

name: Deep Space Explorer Helmet
description: The Andromeda Initiative's mission is one of discovery and exploration, as well as colonization. Readying personnel to journey into harsh environments-and even the void of space was always part of the plan. Thus, the Initiative's custom Deep Space Explorer (DSE) hardsuit is equipped with multiple environment seals, failsafes, a hefty liquid oxygen supply, a formidable kinetic barrier generator, and an array of scientific instruments. Although many were built, most were mysteriously lost en route to Andromeda.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): Extended air supply allows the wearer to breathe in unfriendly environments for up to 48 hours.
features: Darkvision <me-distance length='25' />. Infrared Vision <me-distance length='25' />. You can toggle between the 2 vision types as a free action.

name: Delumcore Overlay
description: Developed by Delumcore Systems, a VI inside this headgear enhances aim when targeting an enemy's vulnerable points.
features: You roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a ranged weapon attack.

name: Duelist Armor
description: Duelist armor was originally commissioned to Elanus Risk Control systems for use in cage fighting and other live-action combat sports. The armor focuses on keeping the wearer alive after a fatal wound because managers were tired of losing so many fighters in the ring. The armor is as light as fabric and allows full range of motion.
features: Once per long rest, if you fall below 0 hit points you immediately become stabilized.

name: Elanus Goliath Gauntlets
description: Arm plating with micro servos that coordinate muscle movements when resistance is encountered.
features: Advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.

name: Enviro-Greaves
description: A set of leg armor that makes the user much more maneuverable in a mountainous or aquatic environment with normally unsuitable terrain.
features: Advantage on Athletics checks made to swim or climb.

name: Freedom Armor
description: Cerberus designed freedom armor to look and feel like standard clothing while providing protection to their agents.

name: Gladiator Armor
description: Elkoss Combine's Gladiator Armor is a simple upgrade to most heavy armor.

name: GUARDIAN Gauntlets
description: Arm gauntlets that contain power cells that fuel a miniature version of a starship's standard GARDIAN point defense lasers.
features: When you are forced to make a saving throw from a heavy weapon attack that required targeting, you may use your reaction to reduce the damage done to you to 0. You may use this feature once per long rest.

name: Hahne-Kedar Tactical Armor
description: A chest plate that disperses weight in a way that makes carrying more equipment bearable.
features: When wearing this armor, treat your Strength ability score as if it were 19 for the purposes of carrying equipment (unless your score is higher, then no effect occurs).

name: Heleus Armor
description: This hardsuit is the ultimate product of Initiative research into Heleus Cluster species. Remnant power sources supply angaran hardware in a frame made possible by kett bio-enhancements and Pathfinder implants. This armor is unequivocally a combat suit, intended for the defense of Initiative and angaran colonies
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): +3 AC

name: Heleus Helmet
description: This hardsuit is the ultimate product of Initiative research into Heleus Cluster species. Remnant power sources supply angaran hardware in a frame made possible by kett bio-enhancements and Pathfinder implants. This armor is unequivocally a combat suit, intended for the defense of Initiative and angaran colonies
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): +3 AC

name: Hoplite Armor
description: With additional research into kinetic barrier devices, Cerberus Skunkworks created the Hoplite Armor. As light and simple as their popular Freedom Armor with a shield generator around the waist, giving it an appearance of ancient Greek hoplites.

name: HyperGuardian Chestplate
description: HyperGuardian hardsuits were built by Kassa Fabrication as a civilian-friendly alternative to the Colossus line intended for private security in heavy-fire situations or extreme environmental conditions. The Initiative considered the bulky and unbreakable HyperGuardian a perfect choice for protecting vulnerable new colonies.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): +1 AC.
Set bonus (3 of 4): +10 Shields, +5 Shield Regen.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor.

name: HyperGuardian Gauntlets
description: HyperGuardian hardsuits were built by Kassa Fabrication as a civilian-friendly alternative to the Colossus line intended for private security in heavy-fire situations or extreme environmental conditions. The Initiative considered the bulky and unbreakable HyperGuardian a perfect choice for protecting vulnerable new colonies.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): +1 AC.
Set bonus (3 of 4): +10 Shields, +5 Shield Regen.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor.

description: HyperGuardian hardsuits were built by Kassa Fabrication as a civilian-friendly alternative to the Colossus line intended for private security in heavy-fire situations or extreme environmental conditions. setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): +1 AC.
Set bonus (3 of 4): +10 Shields, +5 Shield Regen.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with heavy armor.

name: Inferno Armor
description: Built specifically for Cerberus field officers, the Inferno armor has a VI dedicated to recognizing signs of stress and medical trauma. This application helps assess soldiers but can be useful in any high-risk situations. The Inferno's microframe computer also manages biotic amp and omni-tool power, and microservos help the wearer's movements to counteract the armor's weight.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): When you lose hit points, as a reaction, you may expend a charge of medi-gel.
features: +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell saving throw DCs.

name: Inferno Helmet
description: Built specifically for Cerberus field officers, the Inferno armor has a VI dedicated to recognizing signs of stress and medical trauma. This application helps assess soldiers but can be useful in any high-risk situations. The Inferno's microframe computer also manages biotic amp and omni-tool power, and microservos help the wearer's movements to counteract the armor's weight.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): When you lose hit points, as a reaction, you may expend a charge of medi-gel.
features: +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell saving throw DCs.

name: Initiative Chestpiece
description: Standard-issue Andromeda Initiative hardsuits are designed for exploration as much as combat, combining jump-jets, high-grade external and internal sensors, and a variety of atmospheric filters with the usual kinetic barrier generators and ceramic armor plating. Personnel equipped in these suits can enter and leave alien biomes without fear of contamination or hostile wildlife.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): You have 7 levels of exhaustion, you suffer no negative effects at the first level.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You have 8 levels of exhaustion, you suffer no negative effects at the first two levels.

name: Initiative Gauntlets
description: Standard-issue Andromeda Initiative hardsuits are designed for exploration as much as combat, combining jump-jets, high-grade external and internal sensors, and a variety of atmospheric filters with the usual kinetic barrier generators and ceramic armor plating. Personnel equipped in these suits can enter and leave alien biomes without fear of contamination or hostile wildlife.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): You have 7 levels of exhaustion, you suffer no negative effects at the first level.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You have 8 levels of exhaustion, you suffer no negative effects at the first two levels.

name: Initiative Greaves
description: Standard-issue Andromeda Initiative hardsuits are designed for exploration as much as combat, combining jump-jets, high-grade external and internal sensors, and a variety of atmospheric filters with the usual kinetic barrier generators and ceramic armor plating. Personnel equipped in these suits can enter and leave alien biomes without fear of contamination or hostile wildlife.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): You have 7 levels of exhaustion, you suffer no negative effects at the first level.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You have 8 levels of exhaustion, you suffer no negative effects at the first two levels.
features: Your jump distance is tripled. If you jump straight up, you can hover at the apex of your jump until the start of your next turn, at which point, you fall slowly back to the ground, taking half of your movement speed for this turn.

name: Initiative Helmet
description: Standard-issue Andromeda Initiative hardsuits are designed for exploration as much as combat, combining jump-jets, high-grade external and internal sensors, and a variety of atmospheric filters with the usual kinetic barrier generators and ceramic armor plating. Personnel equipped in these suits can enter and leave alien biomes without fear of contamination or hostile wildlife.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): You have 7 levels of exhaustion, you suffer no negative effects at the first level.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You have 8 levels of exhaustion, you suffer no negative effects at the first two levels.
features: Infrared Vision <me-distance length='25' />. Darkvision <me-distance length='25' />. You can toggle between the 2 vision types as a free action.

name: Kestrel Helmet
description: The Kestrel armor system's helmet forgoes traditional transparent visors in favor of a reinforced faceplate with an internal heads-up display. The display connects to redundant micro cameras to allow naturalistic vision inside the well-padded interior.

name: Kett Chestplate
description: Although this hardsuit's basic materials-ceramic armor plating and kinetic padding-are Initiative standard, kett biotech permeates the overall design and feeds directly into the user's nervous system. Kett armor enhances combat prowess through chemical regulation and stimulation.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Your Strength score is 19 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 19 or higher without it.
Set bonus (3 of 4): Your Strength score is 21 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 21 or higher without it.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Your Strength score is 23 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 23 or higher without it.
features: Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

name: Kett Greaves
description: Although this hardsuit's basic materials-ceramic armor plating and kinetic padding-are Initiative standard, kett biotech permeates the overall design and feeds directly into the user's nervous system. Kett armor enhances combat prowess through chemical regulation and stimulation.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Your Strength score is 19 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 19 or higher without it.
Set bonus (3 of 4): Your Strength score is 21 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 21 or higher without it.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Your Strength score is 23 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 23 or higher without it.

name: Kett Helmet
description: Although this hardsuit's basic materials-ceramic armor plating and kinetic padding-are Initiative standard, kett biotech permeates the overall design and feeds directly into the user's nervous system. Kett armor enhances combat prowess through chemical regulation and stimulation.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Your Strength score is 19 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 19 or higher without it.
Set bonus (3 of 4): Your Strength score is 21 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 21 or higher without it.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Your Strength score is 23 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 23 or higher without it.
features: +1 bonus to melee weapon attack and damage rolls.

name: Kett Vambraces
description: Although this hardsuit's basic materials-ceramic armor plating and kinetic padding-are Initiative standard, kett biotech permeates the overall design and feeds directly into the user's nervous system. Kett armor enhances combat prowess through chemical regulation and stimulation.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Your Strength score is 19 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 19 or higher without it.
Set bonus (3 of 4): Your Strength score is 21 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 21 or higher without it.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Your Strength score is 23 while you wear this armor. There is no effect on you if your Strength is 23 or higher without it.
features: +1 bonus to melee weapon attack and damage rolls.

name: Kuwashii Visor
description: Developed by Ariake Technologies, the wearer exchanges full protective coverage for visibility, unencumbered mobility, and increased accuracy.
features: As a bonus action, you choose a creature you can see within <me-distance length='75' />. For the next minute, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to the target whenever you hit it with a weapon attack, and you have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) check you make to find it. You can use this feature 3 times per long rest.

name: Liberator Armor
description: Devlon Industries' Liberator Armor is a simple upgrade to most light armor.

name: Lockdown Greaves
description: A pair of leg armor pieces that connect the wearer's boots to the suit's power supply, turning the boots into a powerful electromagnet.
features: As a bonus action, the wearer can activate the effect of the greaves to stick to the surface they are walking on, provided it's made of metal. This can aid them in walking up walls, upside down, etc. If the surface is metal, the user is immune to being lifted, otherwise, they have advantage on saving throws against being lifted. The effect lasts for 1 minute and can only be used once per short rest.

name: Mantis Armor
description: Hahne-Kedar's line of armor that utilizes arm-length, serrated switchblades in the greaves meant to hook targets. Don't cut yourself!
features: Whenever you hit a target with a melee weapon attack, you may use your reaction to activate your armor's switchblades, dealing an additional 1d6 slashing damage to the target. If you use your reaction this way, you may then use your bonus action to attempt to grapple the target. You have advantage on the Strength (Athletics) check.

name: Maverick Boots
description: There's nothing elegant about this patchwork hardsuit. It mixes various materials and technology from the Heleus Cluster and its microframe computer runs a jumble of barely linked programs. Despite this, or because of it, the armor is highly effective in combat, with targeting and thermal distribution systems second to none.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a weapon attack.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Whenever you roll an 18 or higher on a weapon attack roll, consider it a critical hit.

name: Maverick Vest
description: There's nothing elegant about this patchwork hardsuit. It mixes various materials and technology from the Heleus Cluster and its microframe computer runs a jumble of barely linked programs. Despite this, or because of it, the armor is highly effective in combat, with targeting and thermal distribution systems second to none.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a weapon attack.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Whenever you roll an 18 or higher on a weapon attack roll, consider it a critical hit.

name: Maverick Visor
description: There's nothing elegant about this patchwork hardsuit. It mixes various materials and technology from the Heleus Cluster and its microframe computer runs a jumble of barely linked programs. Despite this, or because of it, the armor is highly effective in combat, with targeting and thermal distribution systems second to none.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a weapon attack.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Whenever you roll an 18 or higher on a weapon attack roll, consider it a critical hit.

name: Maverick Wraps
description: There's nothing elegant about this patchwork hardsuit. It mixes various materials and technology from the Heleus Cluster and its microframe computer runs a jumble of barely linked programs. Despite this, or because of it, the armor is highly effective in combat, with targeting and thermal distribution systems second to none.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): Roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a weapon attack.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Whenever you roll an 18 or higher on a weapon attack roll, consider it a critical hit.

name: Mercenary Armor
description: Basic armor offering a minor upgrade to shield capacitors.

name: Mnemonic Visor
description: Relatively new to the market, the Mnemonic Visor is difficult to find outside Alliance space. Intended for biotic specialists, this headpiece plugs into the rest of the user's suit, gathering data so it can adapt to the wearer's tactics. It boosts biotic performance at critical moments to allow a soldier to perform with greater power than normally possible.
features: When you roll a 1 damage die for an attack you make with a biotic spell, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.

name: N7 Chestplate
description: Interlocking plates of thick, ablative ceramic plates. Designed to be light, effective, and easily repaired.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): Increase your hit points by 1 for each level you have gained.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Increase your hit points by 1 for each level you have gained.
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with medium armor.

name: N7 Defender Armorsuit
description: The Defender Armor is a variation on the N7 Special Forcesâ€™ combat gear, built to protect soldiers in long-running engagements where reinforcements may be sparse. When the wearer fires a weapon, the suit's computers divert energy from the main power cell to the gun's kinetic coils, offering an extra punch. The Defender's storage compartments are designed to hold spare thermal clips, while capacitors throughout the armor provide extra power to shields during critical moments in battle. The armor also comes with an injection system built into the suit and neural-linked bio-monitors that help adjust the wearer's breathing rate and adrenaline levels.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): +1 bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls

name: N7 Defender Helmet
description: The Defender Armor is a variation on the N7 Special Forcesâ€™ combat gear, built to protect soldiers in long-running engagements where reinforcements may be sparse. When the wearer fires a weapon, the suit's computers divert energy from the main power cell to the gun's kinetic coils, offering an extra punch. The Defender's storage compartments are designed to hold spare thermal clips, while capacitors throughout the armor provide extra power to shields during critical moments in battle. The armor also comes with an injection system built into the suit and neural-linked bio-monitors that help adjust the wearer's breathing rate and adrenaline levels.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): +1 bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls

name: N7 Gauntlets
description: A combination of fabric armor with kinetic padding and plates of ablative ceramic for protection.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): Increase your hit points by 1 for each level you have gained.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Increase your hit points by 1 for each level you have gained.
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with medium armor.

name: N7 Greaves
description: Dual layer of fabric armor and kinetic padding beneath thick plates of ablative ceramic and lined with additional kinetic barriers.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): Increase your hit points by 1 for each level you have gained.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Increase your hit points by 1 for each level you have gained.
features: You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with medium armor.

name: N7 Helmet
description: Dual layer of fabric armor and kinetic padding within a lightweight ablative ceramic shell. Comes standard with a suite of communication, navigation, and battlefield awareness software.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): Increase your hit points by 1 for each level you have gained.
Set bonus (4 of 4): Increase your hit points by 1 for each level you have gained.
features: You have advantage on initiative rolls. You are considered proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with medium armor.

name: Onyx Armor
description: Onyx Armor is one of Aldrin Labs' armor lines and used by Alliance special forces personnel. A minor upgrade to stock medium armor.

name: Partisan Armor
description: Batarian State Arms developed a line of armor meant to protect Batarian soldiers for alien diseases and infections.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): You are immune to becoming poisoned and have resistance to poison damage.

name: Partisan Helmet
description: Batarian State Arms developed a line of armor meant to protect Batarian soldiers for alien diseases and infections.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): You are immune to becoming poisoned and have resistance to poison damage.

name: Pathfinder Chestpiece
description: Pathfinder hardsuits are heavily modified from the Initiative suit baseline, foregoing certain scientific instruments in favor of added combat capability. The role of a Pathfinder includes threat neutralization, and improved stabilizers and targeting controls help ensure they can protect his or her team.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You gain a +5 bonus to initiative as long as you aren't incapacitated.

name: Pathfinder Gauntlets
description: Pathfinder hardsuits are heavily modified from the Initiative suit baseline, foregoing certain scientific instruments in favor of added combat capability. The role of a Pathfinder includes threat neutralization, and improved stabilizers and targeting controls help ensure they can protect his or her team.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You gain a +5 bonus to initiative as long as you aren't incapacitated.
features: When you roll a 1 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.

name: Pathfinder Greaves
description: Pathfinder hardsuits are heavily modified from the Initiative suit baseline, foregoing certain scientific instruments in favor of added combat capability. The role of a Pathfinder includes threat neutralization, and improved stabilizers and targeting controls help ensure they can protect his or her team.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You gain a +5 bonus to initiative as long as you aren't incapacitated.
features: Your jump distance is tripled. If you jump straight up, you can hover at the apex of your jump until the start of your next turn, at which point, you fall slowly back to the ground, taking half of your movement speed for this turn.

name: Pathfinder Helmet
description: Pathfinder hardsuits are heavily modified from the Initiative suit baseline, foregoing certain scientific instruments in favor of added combat capability. The role of a Pathfinder includes threat neutralization, and improved stabilizers and targeting controls help ensure they can protect his or her team.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You gain a +5 bonus to initiative as long as you aren't incapacitated.

name: Personal Shield Generator
description: A personal shield generator that offers shields outside of wearing armor.
features: Improved models can be purchased. 10,000 for each 5 shield points, and 8,000 for 5 additional regen. Max is 30 shield points and 15 regen. These additional shields do not stack with your armor's shields.

name: Power Reservoir Legguards
description: A set of greaves that have batteries designed to conserve biotic power.
features: As a reaction to having 0 barrier ticks, restore all of your barrier ticks. You may use this ability once per long rest.

name: Predator Armor
description: Standard issue armor for Turian infantry. The interlocking plates provide increased protection against potentially fatal wounds.
features: Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit

name: Reckoner-Knight Armet
description: The Reckoner-Knight armor was originally worn by the winners of Earth's Urban Combat Championship 2186, the Rhode Island Knights. A military-grade version of this equipment was presented to longtime Knight fans at the Alliance's Rhode Island base, in thanks for their passionate (and vocal) support during the EUCC championship matches. Beneath this armor's medieval-gothic facade lie a host of biofeedback systems intended to monitor the wearer's health and combat performance. Micro-servos maximize damage done in close-quarters combat, while a beefed-up power cell feeds energy into weapons systems to increase projectile velocity. Befitting gear originally designed for a full-contact sport, a sophisticated shield system also offers the wearer solid protection from incoming attacks.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): When you make a Charisma-based skill check, your Charisma is considered to be a 19. This has no effect if your Charisma is higher than 19.
features: Whenever you lose hit points, you may use your reaction to expend one medi-gel (provided you have any medi-gel remaining).

name: Reckoner-Knight Armorsuit
description: The Reckoner-Knight armor was originally worn by the winners of Earth's Urban Combat Championship 2186, the Rhode Island Knights. A military-grade version of this equipment was presented to longtime Knight fans at the Alliance's Rhode Island base, in thanks for their passionate (and vocal) support during the EUCC championship matches. Beneath this armor's medieval-gothic facade lie a host of biofeedback systems intended to monitor the wearer's health and combat performance. Micro-servos maximize damage done in close-quarters combat, while a beefed-up power cell feeds energy into weapons systems to increase projectile velocity. Befitting gear originally designed for a full-contact sport, a sophisticated shield system also offers the wearer solid protection from incoming attacks.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): When you make a Charisma-based skill check, your Charisma is considered to be a 19. This has no effect if your Charisma is higher than 19.
features: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

name: Recon Hood
description: A hood issued to covert action teams, this model's optic display interfaces with most small arm's auto-targeting software, linking hand and eye for improved accuracy and increased weapon damage. Ballistic-mesh fabric and composite ceramic plating provide necessary armor, and the integral air filter helps in hostile environments.
features: Infrared Vision <me-distance length='150' />. Darkvision <me-distance length='150' />. You can toggle between vision types as a free action.

name: Remnant Battery
description: This armor was designed from scratch by the Initiative using Remnant technology. Its servos, microframe computer, and kinetic barrier generators are all dependent on Remnant science and artifacts. This resilient and regenerative hardsuit has an energy surplus, though its internal systems can be difficult to properly monitor.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).

Set bonus (4 of 4): You may jumpstart your shields any number of times. Each time you do, roll a d20. On a roll of 8 or less, your shields malfunction: you lose all shield points and they cannot be regained until you finish a long rest.

name: Remnant Helmet
description: This armor was designed from scratch by the Initiative using Remnant technology. Its servos, microframe computer, and kinetic barrier generators are all dependent on Remnant science and artifacts. This resilient and regenerative hardsuit has an energy surplus, though its internal systems can be difficult to properly monitor.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).

Set bonus (4 of 4): You may jumpstart your shields any number of times. Each time you do, roll a d20. On a roll of 8 or less, your shields malfunction: you lose all shield points and they cannot be regained until you finish a long rest.
features: Darkvision <me-distance length='50' />. Infrared Vision <me-distance length='50' />. You may toggle between vision types as a free action.

name: Remnant Tasset
description: This armor was designed from scratch by the Initiative using Remnant technology. Its servos, microframe computer, and kinetic barrier generators are all dependent on Remnant science and artifacts. This resilient and regenerative hardsuit has an energy surplus, though its internal systems can be difficult to properly monitor.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).

Set bonus (4 of 4): You may jumpstart your shields any number of times. Each time you do, roll a d20. On a roll of 8 or less, your shields malfunction: you lose all shield points and they cannot be regained until you finish a long rest.
features: Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.

name: Remnant Vambraces
description: This armor was designed from scratch by the Initiative using Remnant technology. Its servos, microframe computer, and kinetic barrier generators are all dependent on Remnant science and artifacts. This resilient and regenerative hardsuit has an energy surplus, though its internal systems can be difficult to properly monitor.
setBonus: Set bonus (3 of 4): When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).

Set bonus (4 of 4): You may jumpstart your shields any number of times. Each time you do, roll a d20. On a roll of 8 or less, your shields malfunction: you lose all shield points and they cannot be regained until you finish a long rest.

name: Rosenkov Reflex Armor
description: Sturdy armor that gathers real-time battle telemetry and and onboard combat computer that can help a combatant move faster than they can think.
features: Once per short rest, you may take 2 reactions within a single turn.

name: Rosenkov Snaring Gauntlets
description: Arm pieces that were designed with trench warfare in mind, they have strong electromagnets that prove especially useful when regulated by combat computers.
features: You are immune to dropping your weapon if hit by any effect that would otherwise disarm you.

name: Scavenger Armor
description: The Auto-Recycling Technical and Combat Interface Armor-a name only slightly less awkward in the original turian-is better known as the Scavenger Hardsuit. Originally built by Armax Arsenal in the Milky Way, the Scavenger incorporates quarian technology that allows the user to better analyze, interface, and integrate foreign components.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): You are immune to disease and the poisoned condition and you have resistance to poison damage.
features: You have 2 additional weapon slots (or increase your carry capacity by 20kg).

name: Scavenger Helmet
description: The Auto-Recycling Technical and Combat Interface Armor-a name only slightly less awkward in the original turian-is better known as the Scavenger Hardsuit. Originally built by Armax Arsenal in the Milky Way, the Scavenger incorporates quarian technology that allows the user to better analyze, interface, and integrate foreign components.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 2): You are immune to disease and the poisoned condition and you have resistance to poison damage.
features: You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) and Intelligence (Science) rolls when analyzing objects.

name: Securitel Helmet
description: The Securitel Helmet was originally designed as riot-gear. It is covered in ablative plating, well-padded to lessen damage from shocks, blows and bullet impacts. The helmet's emitters boost shielding in the rest of the armor, while its onboard computers monitor the wearer's heart-rate and central nervous system.
features: Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit

name: Sentry Interface
description: This visor works with the Sentry system, a software application that optimizes an armor suit's microframe computer. When the Sentry system is running, more power can be devoted to shield management.
features: Once per short rest, as a reaction to taking damage, you may jumpstart your shield regen and immediately gain shield points equal to your regen amount.

name: Serrice Adaptor Gauntlets
description: A pair of gauntlets that have micro fabricators in their frames. These can spread omni-gel through the rest of the hardsuit, inuring the combatant to a type of damage.
features: Every long rest, you can designate a type of damage except bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. You gain resistance to it until you take another long rest.

name: Serrice Rimebane Armor
description: Chest plating with auxiliary power cells that defrost spots of crystalline ice caused by cryo rounds on impact.

name: Sirta Parade Armor
description: Glossy armor that shines in the light, designed to look good as its first function.
features: Advantage on Persuasion and Performance checks.

name: Skirmish Armor
description: Batarian State Arms' Skirmish armor provides enhanced speed to better escape the blast of the grenade you just threw.
features: Increase your walking speed by <me-distance length='10' />.

name: Stealth Greaves
description: Greaves that secrete a highly advanced lubricant in the joints.
features: While you wear these greaves, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Stealth checks that rely on moving silently.

name: Stock Heavy Armor
description: A cheap and simple set of heavy armor.

name: Stock Light Armor
description: A cheap and simple set of light armor.

name: Stock Medium Armor
description: A cheap and simple set of medium armor.

name: Strider Legguards
description: Greaves that use a set of mass effect field generators to alter the wearer's gravity, making certain maneuvers much more manageable.
features: Increase your walking speed by <me-distance length='15' />.

name: Survivor Armor
description: A simple set of armor made by Devlon Industries providing moderate protection.

name: Terminus Assault Chestpiece
description: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You have resistance to cold and fire damage. You have advantage on stealth checks against thermal sensors and creatures or devices using infrared vision.

name: Terminus Assault Gauntlets
description: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You have resistance to cold and fire damage. You have advantage on stealth checks against thermal sensors and creatures or devices using infrared vision.
features: +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls

name: Terminus Assault Greaves
description: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You have resistance to cold and fire damage. You have advantage on stealth checks against thermal sensors and creatures or devices using infrared vision.
features: Increase your walking speed by <me-distance length='10' />.

name: Terminus Assault Helmet
description: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.
setBonus: Set bonus (2 of 4): +1 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.
Set bonus (4 of 4): You have resistance to cold and fire damage. You have advantage on stealth checks against thermal sensors and creatures or devices using infrared vision.

name: Titan Armor
description: Titan armor was created by Rosenkov Materials as an upgrade to their other lines of heavy armor.

name: Umbra Visor
description: A next-generation night-vision device that assists targeting. By detecting the focal point of the wearer's eyes and enhancing the image at that location, the visor helps direct a biotic power or a shot from an omni-tool exactly where the wearer is looking.
features: You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.

name: Ursa Armor
description: Hahne-Kedar's Urse armor is known for its "think hide", and is a moderate update over stock armor.

name: Warlord Armor
description: A favorite for Krogran gladiators. The armor is finished with a silver polish, which quickly becomes dented, scuffed, and bloodied. These "battle scars" tell the tale of a Krogan's feats.
features: Resistance to slashing and bludgeoning damage.
